thread.title: Bevenvour sets the table for Washingtown Twp. volleyball
thread.title_full: Bevenvour sets the table for Washingtown Twp. volleyball

title: Bevenvour sets the table for Washingtown Twp. volleyball
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports 
"It was really exciting and I was really happy," Bevenour said. "It's not just an honor to me, it's an honor to my team because without my passers or my hitters to put the ball down, I wouldn't be where I am today." 
The junior setter keeps the ball in her room as a reminder of her accomplishments and to stay focused on the rest of the season. 
"I have it set up in my room, every time I walk in the door it just makes me smile," Bevenour said. 
Bevenour makes herself an indispensable player as a setter and captain. Her quick judgement and ability to properly asses her opponent's defensive lineup help keep her team on track during games. 
"Without a good setter, you don't have a team. Your setter controls the game, she has to get to the pass. . . then she has to decide the best person to set to based on what's on the other side," coach Barbara McBrearty said. "She makes the decisions of whose going to do the hitting." 
Bevenour's aggression and fierce determination on the court have allowed her to achieve her goals and stand out as a player. 
"Kyra sets her goal extremely high, she's very competitive, and she will do anything she can to get to the ball," McBrearty said. "It's an honor for her and she deserves it." 
The Minutemen have a record of 6-8 through Tuesday and hope to capture two more wins in order to qualify for the playoffs. 
Regardless of how their season plays out, Bevenour has no plans on stopping her aggression now that she's got 500 under her belt. 
"I am trying to get 1,000 by my senior year," she said.
